template<class T>
class bd::Array< T >

Dynamic Array.

template<class T >
bd::Array< T >::Array ( const_pointer  carray  )  [inline]

Create a Array from a given carray.

Parameters:
carray The null-terminated array to create the object from.
Postcondition:
A ArrayBuf has been initialized.

The buffer has been filled with the array.

Test:
Array test("Some array");

template<class T >
bd::Array< T >::Array ( const size_type  newSize  )  [inline, explicit]

Create an empty Array container with at least the specified elements in size.

Parameters:
newSize Reserve at least this many buckets for this Array.
Postcondition:
This array's memory will also never be shrunk.

A buffer has been created.

int  n = -1 
) [inline, inherited]

Appends given rca to the end of buffer.

Parameters:
rca The rca to be appended.
n How many characters to copy from the ReferenceCountedArray object.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated. This is the same as inserting the rca at the end of the buffer.

void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::append ( const_reference  item  )  [inline, inherited]

Appends one item to end of buffer.

Parameters:
item The item to be appended.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated.

The item is appended at the end of the buffer. This is the same as inserting the item at the end of the buffer.

void bd::ReferenceCountedArray< T >::insert ( int  k,
const_reference  item 
) [inline, inherited]

Insert an item at the given index.

Parameters:
k The index to insert at.
item The item to be inserted.
Postcondition:
A buffer is allocated.

If the old buffer was too small, it is enlarged.

The item is inserted at the given index.

int  n = -1 
) [inline, inherited]

Parameters:

rca The rca to insert.
n The length to insert.
Postcondition:

Parameters:
